questions.text: Which of the following statements is correct with respect to intraocular tumours?

options.label: A
options.text: Cavernous hemangioma is a malignant intraocular secondary tumor

options.label: B
options.text: Rhabdomyosarcoma is a malignant secondary intraorbital tumour that mostly affected the adult age group

options.label: C
options.text: Retinoblastoma is the most common intraorbital tumour affecting the childhood age group

options.label: D
options.text: Benign epithelioma is arise from the pigment epithelium of the retina

questions.correct_answer: D. Benign epithelioma is arise from the pigment epithelium of the retina
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Benign epithelioma is arise from the pigment epithelium of the retina Classification A. Primary tumours Option C - Neuroblastic tumours -These arise from the sensory retina (retinoblastoma and astrocytoma) and pigment epithelium (benign epithelioma and melanotic malignant tumours). Mesodermal angiomata g., cavernous haemangioma. Option D - Phakomatoses These include: angiomatosis retinae (von Hippel-Lindau disease), tuberous sclerosis (Bourneville’s disease), neurofibromatosis (von Recklinghausen’s disease and, encephalo-trigeminal angiomatosis (Sturge-Weber syndrome). B. Secondary tumours Direct extension g., from malignant melanoma of the choroid. Option A - Metastatic carcinomas from the gastrointestinal tract, genitourinary tract, lungs, and pancreas. Metastatic sarcomas. Metastatic malignant melanoma from the skin.

Highyeild:

Retinoblastoma is the most common primary intraocular malignancy in childhood Occurs due to mutation of RB1 gene located on 113q14 Inheritance of a single inactive allele of the RB1 gene causes a predisposition to cancer thus, AD inheritance But the second inactivation of the gene is needed for RB to occur phenotypically, thus it has AR expression Knudson's two-hit hypothesis explains the loss of heterozygosity B/L most common of all heritable type Pinealoblastoma is most commonly associated with RB The most common secondary malignant neoplasm is osteosarcoma

Incidence - It is the most common intraocular tumour of childhood occurring in 1 in 20,000 live births.
